required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Simple Needle Guide Device for Ultrasound-guided Internal Jugular Vein Catheterization in Surgical Patients: a Randomized-controlled Trial
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Simple Needle Guide Device for Ultrasound-guided Internal Jugular Vein Catheterization in Surgical Patients: a Randomized-controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of simple needle guide device for ultrasound-guided internal jugular vein catheterization in surgical patients

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: sono with simple needle guide device group sono only group

primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 5 minutes after insertion of puncture needle
primary_outcome.description: First access success rate was defined as the number of sono-guided catheterization obtained within first attempt

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes after the beginning of the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: defined as the time in seconds between the beginning of the procedure and guide-wire insertion
incidence of Pneumothorax, Haemothorax, Hydrothorax, carotid artery puncture, Hematoma, Malpositions, puncture of posterior wall of internal jugular vein

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes after the beginning of the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: In order to measure the degree of difficulty felt by the subjects during the procedure, a 100mm visual analogue scale was used to measure 10 difficulty levels (100mm; ease, 0mm ; difficult)

secondary_outcome.measure: the number of separate skin puncture
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 minutes after the beginning of the procedure

arm_group.arm_group_label: sono with simple needle guide device group (Group D)
arm_group.description: sono with simple needle guide device Simple needle guide device was attached to the sono probe. Device was designed to assist the detection of the puncture site. After induction of anesthesia, sono-guided internal jugular vein cannulation was performed.
sono only group After induction of anesthesia, sono-guided internal jugular vein cannulation was performed.

intervention.description: In Group D, simple needle guide device was attached to the sono probe. Device was designed to assist the detection of the puncture site. After induction of anesthesia, sono-guided internal jugular vein cannulation was performed.
intervention.arm_group_label: sono with simple needle guide device group (Group D)

intervention.description: In group S, sono-guided internal jugular vein cannulation was performed after induction of anesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. adult ( â‰§19 years old)
2. patients undergoing elective surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
1. emergency surgery
2. patients under cervical immobilization
3. anatomical abnormality for Right internal jugular vein catheterization
4. infection or hematoma at puncture site
5. patients who did not need internal jugular vein catheterization

facility.name: Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine, Yonsei University College of Medicine
